name: aerosol_species_mole_fraction
units: moles per mole of dry air

name: cloud_base_lowest_height
description / notes: Height above surface of the base of the lowest cloud seen (coded 0-9)

name: cloud_genus_base_height
description / notes: Height of base of cloud whose genus is c

name: lowest_cloud_amout
description / notes: low or (if low clouds don't exist) middle cloud amount

name: dew_point_depression
description / notes: Dew point depression is also called dew point deficit. It is the amount by which the air temperature exceeds its dew point temperature. Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

name: dew_point_temperature
description / notes: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

name: relative_humidity
description / notes: NA usually abbreviated as UUU in WMO but I like rh

name: specific_humidity
description / notes: specific means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

name: precipitation_instensity_liquid
description / notes: Precipitation intensity at surface (liquid or solid)

name: adjunct_temperature_barometer
description / notes: temperature of the adjunct thermometer to the barometer to reduce pressure to 0ºC

name: air_pressure_at_sea_level
description / notes: sea_level means mean sea level,  which is close to the geoid in sea areas. Air pressure at sea level is the quantity often abbreviated as MSLP or PMSL.

name: pressure_tendency_characteristics
description / notes: characteristic of pressure tendency (used in synoptic maps)

name: air_temperature
description / notes: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air,  not the surface (skin) temperature.

name: daily_maximum_air_temperature
description / notes: Lot 1 is using Tx - WMO abbrev.

name: daily_maximum_grass_temperature
description / notes: Lot 1 is using TGx - Grass maximum thermometer is 5 cm above ground

name: daily_minimum_air_temperature
description / notes: Lot 1 is using Tn - WMO abbrev.

name: daily_minimum_grass_temperature
description / notes: Lot 1 is using TGn - Grass minimum thermometer is 5 cm above ground

name: soil_temperature
description / notes: Lot 1 is using Ts - WMO abbrev.

name: water_temperature
description / notes: Water (sea, river, lake) temperature at depth indicated

name: horizontal_visibility in air
description / notes: The visibility is the distance at which something can be seen.

name: past_weather_2
description / notes: past weather 2 - most frequent phomenon (used in synoptic maps)

name: eastward_wind_speed
description / notes: Eastward indicates a vector component which is positive when directed eastward (negative westward). Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.)

name: northward_wind_speed
description / notes: Northward indicates a vector component which is positive when directed northward (negative southward). Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.)

name: wind_from_direction
description / notes: direction from which the wind is blowing Lot 1 uses dd  - WMO abbrev.

name: wind_speed
description / notes: Speed is the magnitude of velocity. Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) The wind speed is the magnitude of the wind velocity. Lot 1 uses ff  - WMO abbrev.

name: wind_speed_of_gust
description / notes: Speed is the magnitude of velocity. Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) The wind speed is the magnitude of the wind velocity. A gust is a sudden brief period of high wind speed. In an observed timeseries of wind speed,  the gust wind speed can be indicated by a cell_methods of maximum for the time-interval. In an atmospheric model which has a parametrised calculation of gustiness,  the gust wind speed may be separately diagnosed from the wind speed. Lot 1 uses fx  - WMO abbrev.

name: wind_speed_max
description / notes: Maximum observed wind speed over specified period Lot 1 uses fm  - WMO abbrev.
